text:
e="preserve">Thomas Rulon Osmond (born October 26, 1947) is an American musician and activist. He was born in Ogden, Utah. He is known mostly as a non-performing member of the Osmond family. Osmond is the first deaf missionaries from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
His siblings are Alan, Wayne, Merrill, Jay, Donny, Marie and Jimmy.
Osmond worked for the United States Postal Service for 28 years before retiring in 2014.
On July 7, 2018, Osmond underwent a quadruple bypass surgery, but suffered complications and was placed under life-support.

annotations.surface_form: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
